intro: Lapsana glandulosa, commonly known as the clustered groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming from June to September. Lapsana glandulosa is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas, where it thrives in dry, sunny conditions.
